item.title: Google Earth on Giant Touch Screen
Social Business Forecast: 2011 The Year of Integration (Jeremiah Owyang Leweb10 Presentation)
Kodak to launch WiFi Video Camera?
item.description: They showed a good example at their stand for other brands to follow, by lending their cameras out for the people at LeWeb to try out. The cellphone manufactures and carriers should learn from Kodak and Madlen to help others help you by using your products.

item.title: LeWeb10 Google Shopping Presentation on Vimeo
LeWeb Startup Competition Winners
item.description: Out of the 16 startups that where selected to compete at LeWeb10, the 3 finalists have been awarded a price each: Virality prize: Paper.Li Technology prize: Waze Originality prize: Super Marmite Prize of the audience: Deways

item.title: Daniel Santos about LeWeb10
item.description: Daniel Santos, MBA Solvay student and project manager at Toyota in Brussels, tells us about his LeWeb10 expectations: the startups & people to meet.

item.title: Renault to Rent the Batteries of Its New Electric Cars
item.description: Renault is bringing an interesting business model to the market with its new electric cars: they will sell the cars and rent the batteries. Advantages for the users: no worries about lifetime of the batteries, recycling taken care of by the company. Advantage for the company: recurring revenue and stronger bond with clients. Matthieu Tenenbaum, deputy electric car program director, presents the new electric cars (Twizy, Fluence and Dezire), and talks about the business model and partnerships with cities and corporations.

item.title: I Want To Drive a Twizy at #LeWeb10 !
item.description: If you know me, you know I hate driving. But I really want to drive a Twizy electric city car (no driving license needed.) I will be test driving a Fluence later on the day. Disclosure: Renault pays for my travel and lodging in Paris for LeWeb, but I’m publishing what I want and when I want üôÇ

item.title: At this time tomorrow I should be here…
Live Streaming #LeWeb10 (Plus Social Streams)
item.description: For those that can not make it to LeWeb this year, an easy way to watch the plenary and the startup competition and to follow what is said about it in social media. You can also track the hashtags #leweb10 and #leweb. I will be watching all this live in Paris, twitting about it (follow @ramonsuarez) and hopefully also blogging right here at ramonsuarez.com. Enjoy! The Plenary Startup Competition ( dec 8th ) & Plenary II ( dec 9th )

item.title: Lo??c Le Meur & LeWeb10 (interview)
item.description: These are the responses given by Lo√Øc to the short questionnary I sent him. He was really quick tp answer! What is LeWeb like for Lo√Øc Le Meur? LeWeb is a tool box for the european entpreneur: from the inspiration to find ideas to start a business to networking with Google, Microsoft or Facebook and raising angel or VC money. They can do it all during two days. This year we even have a ‚Äúhow to get acquired‚Äù panel to help them understand how to sell their business if they like.

item.title: Entrevista: Julio Alonso, LeWeb y el futuro (Loogic.com)
item.description: In this interview we discussed his coming participation in LeWeb10 and also his ideas about the future of Media and the Internet.
